trans-unit.source: Enables Windows authentication with client application services.
You can use client application services to validate users by using Windows authentication.
To enable Windows authentication, you configure your application to use the ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider class.
For more information, see [How to: Configure Client Application Services](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
After configuration, you can validate users by calling the `static` <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method internally calls the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.ValidateUser%2A> method.

The <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method automatically authenticates the current user and sets the `static` <xref:System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to a <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ClientRolePrincipal> object that contains the current <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity>.

If a <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientRoleProvider> is configured for your application, you can use the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ClientRolePrincipal> object to retrieve user role information from the roles service.

You can retrieve a reference to the current ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider instance through the `static` <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.Provider%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

You can use the membership provider reference to call the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method directly.

Additionally, you will need the membership provider reference to call the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.Logout%2A> method, which is not available in the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider> base class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider"></xref> class.
This property is not used by this class.
Setting this property has no effect.
The name of the application using the custom membership provider.

Windows authentication uses the identity supplied by the operating system when a user logs on to the computer or domain.
Therefore, properties related to user credentials are not relevant for this class.

Logs out the user.

For users authenticated through client application services, the `static` <xref:System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to a <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ClientRolePrincipal> object that enables access to the configured role service.

The Logout method resets the <xref:System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal%2A> property to a <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal> object that contains the current <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity>.
After you call this method, you can no longer retrieve roles for the user through the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientRoleProvider> class.
To reauthenticate the current user, call the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

Automatically authenticates the current user by using the identity supplied by the operating system.

When you configure your application to use the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider> class, the `static` <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method will use this method for its implementation.

The ValidateUser method automatically authenticates the current user and sets the `static` <xref:System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to a <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ClientRolePrincipal> object that contains the current <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity>.

If a <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientRoleProvider> is configured for your application, you can use the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ClientRolePrincipal> object to retrieve user role information from the roles service.
Must be <xref:System.String> or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Must be <xref:System.String> or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Always <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
